result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L Groelle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cts 1 & 2: Paid in full from bond posted. Remaining bail returned to poster.

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08.
Court authorizes huber to include one hour bible study on Wednesdays and Fridays at 6am at the Hope Community Church located in Manitowoc WI.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel unsure at this time if defendant will qualify for public defender representation.  Counsel waives reading.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $2000 cash bail w/conditions.
